fields.description:
I have space viewable to anonymous users with few pages restricted view only to some group. I have {children} mark on space home page and it correctly hides restricted pages if home page is accessed by anonymous user. If I create another page containing {index} viewable to anonymous users, they can acctually read start of those restricted pages there. Now I can also restrict this index page, which "solves" the problem. I didn't try another scenario, but I think that if anonymous users have right to even add pages, they can create such {index} page with no possibility to prevent them to read parts of "secret" pages again.

I think that proper behavior is to omit restricted pages in index if I don't have the rights to view them.
fields.summary: Space Index always shows even restricted pages

fields.description:
Problem: 
When using JIRAPORTLET and JIRAISSUES macros in Confluence whith both JIRA and Confluence being secured with HTTPS (using client certificates) the problem is that these portlets are not working ( a known problem) . A workaround would be (at least when both JIRA and Confluence are installed on the same machine) to configure the Apache for localhost calls to work without the client certificates (without SSL).
Therefore the JIRAPORTLET can be used with an adapted URL parameter using http://localhost/..
BUT the problem now is that all links in the displayed portlet are generated with this 'wrong' localhost domain! 

Solution:
The portlet generates all links with the base URL set in the general configuration of the called JIRA instance!

Currently this is a real crtical issue in our customer project that this is not working!
fields.summary: Using JIRA base-URL for JIRAISSUES links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5302].
  {panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 19, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
I’m excited to let you know that the [latest release of Crowd Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-3-3-release-notes-958762272.html] features the ability for you to delegate user admin management to space admins, with the ‘delegated group level admin’ feature.

For those of you who aren’t familiar with [Crowd Data Center|https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/data-center/crowd], it offers one place to manage your users, groups and directories and easily integrate your identity infrastructure across all self-hosted Atlassian products 

I’m leaving this suggestion open, as I appreciate that this only provides a solution to those of you who currently have, or are considering investing in Crowd. However, to set expectations, this isn’t something we’re currently planning on working on within Confluence Server.

Best
Jenny | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server

{panel}

Atlassians,

As per my understanding, right now user management is completely done by confluence administrators.
Hence very simple task like creating user account, adding them to different user groups for any space; can be done by only by confluence administrator.

I was wondering is it possible to delegate this task to Space Administrator as those are right guys to take decision on whom they want to add to their space and if they want to users to specific user-groups. As a Confluence Administrator, I don't want to spend my time in doing these time consuming tasks for hundreds of spaces, when space admins are better suited to do that.

Any idea when such kind of feature will be available ? Please let's know.

{panel}
*Current* options as suggested by Atlassian [Comment by David Soul on 22nd Oct]:

1. Install the Custom Space User Management (CSUM) Plugin to allow space administrators to manage users at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Custom+Space+User+Management+Plugin

*At last I end up in developing this CSUM plugin (version 1.0). Version 2.0 (currently rc3 release) is much better with many requested features and better UI with very active contributions from Gary, Ren, Andy*

2. Install the Invite Plugin to allow space administrators to invite users by email from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Invite+Plugin

3. Use external user management such as LDAP or Active Directory and allow space administrator to grant users through there

4. Grant site administration rights

5. Grant site admin rights to a specific user and ask space admins to delegate their user administration tasks to this person
{panel}

thanks,
Rajendra
fields.summary: User management delegation to Space Admins

fields.summary: Upgrade from CONF 1.4.4 to 2.1.3 and restore of site backup leads to curious page states in some spaces

fields.description: We have 1500 user and a lot of content and we are just starting with 33 spaces and a 210 MB backup zip file. But what about 300 spaces and a 10 GB backup file (just an example) or more?
fields.summary: What is the limit for a complete site restore from the xml backup file concerning the file size

fields.description:
WYSIWYG seems to add a lot of new carriage returns on edit. With a few round trips, this means more and more space appears in the page (ie it doesn't happen once, it keeps happening).

Create a page like this (wiki notation):

{quote}This is a quote{quote}

This is a paragraph.

{note}This is a note{note}

This is another paragraph.

Now save it. Now see what it looks like (HTML). Now edit it as WYSIWYG and just save it again. Now see all the added whitespace. Now edit as WYSIWYG and save it again. More whitespace. Etc etc. {note} and {quote} macros are particularly obvious examples of this bug.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG space-adding errors

fields.description:
This issue is actually with version 2.1.3. When editing an existing page in the Rich Text editor, any anchor link in this format:

[#MySection]

Is unexpectedly changed to:

[MySection]

An ugly workaround is to make the Wiki Markup editor the default editor, then edit the page and change anchor links to the following format:

[Alias for MySection|#MySection]
fields.summary: Existing anchor links are converted to page links by Rich Text editor

fields.description:
If you try to select a template when creating a page on Internet Explorer 6 in the wiki markup tab (whether it is the default or not) a JavaScript error is thrown. Selecting the rich text tab and trying to select a template again works.

This only occurs when ISO-8859-1 has been set as the character encoding for Confluence. If it is UTF-8, saving works.

This seems to be independent of the database encoding (it was originally uncovered on an instance with the DB encoding set to latin1).
It also seems to be independent of the browser encoding setting.

Switching to rich text mode allows the user to select the template.
FireFox 1.5 doesn't seem to suffer from the same problem.
fields.summary: Selecting a page template when creating a page throws a JavaScript error in wiki markup mode in Internet Explorer with ISO-8859-1

fields.description:
Trying to comment on a page on Internet Explorer 6 in the wiki markup tab (whether it is the default or not) doesn't work. The Post and preview buttons don't do anything when clicked.

This only occurs when ISO-8859-1 has been set as the character encoding for Confluence. If it is UTF-8, saving works.

This seems to be independent of the database encoding (it was originally uncovered on an instance with the DB encoding set to latin1).
It also seems to be independent of the browser encoding setting.

Switching to rich text mode allows the user to comment.
FireFox 1.5 doesn't seem to suffer from the same problem.
fields.summary: Post/Preview buttons don't work when commenting in wiki markup mode in Internet Explorer with ISO-8859-1

fields.description:
Trying to create or edit a page on Internet Explorer 6 in the wiki markup tab (whether it is the default or not) doesn't work. The Save and cancel buttons at the top and bottom don't do anything when clicked.

This only occurs when ISO-8859-1 has been set as the character encoding for Confluence. If it is UTF-8, saving works.

This seems to be independent of the database encoding (it was originally uncovered on an instance with the DB encoding set to latin1).
It also seems to be independent of the browser encoding setting.

Switching to rich text mode allows the user to save.
FireFox 1.5 doesn't seem to suffer from the same problem.
fields.summary: Save/Cancel buttons don't work when creating/editing a page in wiki markup mode in Internet Explorer with ISO-8859-1

fields.description:
When using Confluence as documentation system with a lot of anchor tags per article, it would be practical to have the anchors marked with a small symbol next to the text (e.g. on the left margin) including a function that copies the whole link (URL + anchor tag) to the clipboard (or sth. similar).

Normally, a requestor (reader) only wants to read the text part that describes his/her question or answer on a problem. In this case it would be easy to send him/her the complete link via email instead of looking in the wiki code via the edit function or searching for the link in the browser information. 
(With our customers and interested parties it happens quite often that we have to send them a  link with anchor describing their problem or question in our software documentation) 

Two aspects can be additionally considered:
- switching on/off by space because this function makes only sense when a lot of anchor tags are used and links are mailed to interested people
- deciding to use either tiny or full links via config switch
fields.summary: Show anchor tags in view mode with small symbol - including function to retrieve the URL to the anchor

fields.description:
Suggestion that we should diable the edit tab when in edit mode: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-2361

Seems sensible, especially now that we don't warn a user that they are about to lose changes (relying on the draft functionality to allow them to recover -- but they may not understand how to use that)
fields.summary: Disable edit tab when in edit mode

fields.description:
Situation:  (my customer stated the following)  I need to establish some user groups to support information access control at the page level.  In other words,  I want to use the view and edit permission on each page to control who sees and changes the pages.  To do that I need three distinct user groups.

<space name> Council
<space name> Technical
<space name> Country

Note that we already have the <space name>-administrators group.

I then need to be able to populate them with appropriate people.

Issue:  As space admins can't add Confluence users and groups directly (only people in the Confluence-administrators group can or users can sign up).  With that, we see that the space admin's options are:

Option #1 -  The confluence-administrator can create the 3 groups as described above and assign new or existing users to them.   This is not a feasible solution for the confluence administrators as it creates too much admin work.   Please advise if there is a way to populate Confluence's group/user account information from an external source ?   A xml file or sql (how to add password as it is hashed) ?  We would like to refer all space-related admin work to space admins rather than the Confluence administrators.   Question: Although the LDAP integration has been improved in Confluence version 2.1, don't we still have to create user accounts in Confluence to match LDAP ?  If so, using LDAP still doesn't resolve the situation described above.        

Option #2 - The confluence-administrator will not create the 3 groups.  The space admin will ask people to sign up first so he/she can assign individual users the appropriate permissions (this is being done today by the space admins).  

Since option #2 relies on user accounts (vs. group accounts), we would like to request that you add the capability so we could select multiple users for Restrictions.  Currently, only one single user (myself) and multiple groups can be selected.

Thanks.

Cathy Ran
The Boeing Company
fields.summary: Select multiple users for Restrictions and a way way to populate Confluence's group/user account information from an external source

fields.description: RSS produced by Confluence 2.1.1 doesn't seem to work with the FeedDemon RSS Reader (http://bradsoft.com/feeddemon/index.asp)  It does not recognize the feed as a valid RSS feed.  Indeed I went to validate the RSS1.0, the RSS2.0, and the Atom Feed at feedvalicator.org and none of them validate.
fields.summary: RSS doesn't work in FeedDemon

fields.description:
This is a symptom of CONF-5254, when duplicate labels exist on the system. An error like this may appear:

HibernateSystemException: query did not return a unique result: 2

The following query can be used to identify the offending labels:

select name, labelid from label group by name, labelid having count(name) > 1

and any duplicate labels can then be removed from the LABEL table. Relationships in the CONTENT_LABEL table will have to be mapped to the remaining label ID.
fields.summary: HibernateSystemException: "query did not return a unique result" when performing label/space operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5254].
  {panel}

In some cases, it's possible for two labels to be created with the same name (even though we do checks for this). It can occur when there are two parallel requests (via the web or XML-RPC), which try to add the same (non-existent) label. Since they're in separate transactions, it's not possible to see that another session is trying to create the label, so both end up in the DB.

Possible solutions to this:

Write a periodic task that merges any duplicate labels (and the affected content)
Isolate the sections of the current transaction in the save process, to narrow the window in which this can occur
Add some sort of read/write filtering to the transaction so the changes can be seen before the transaction ends (??? - Scott's suggestion)
fields.summary: Duplicate labels can be created

fields.description:
Its taking from 20-40s to load/edit a page... And the reason why is some sub-optimal calls to user.getGroups() 

The problem is that you end up calling user.getGroups() in loops with iterations in excess of 500.

With external user management (ie jira jdbc provider) this translates to 100's of indentical queries on the db.... 
SELECT group_name FROM membershipbase WHERE user_name = ?
(with hibernate you might get away with it due to the caching - but in this case, hibernate is merely hiding your problem, not fixing it)

Essentially, it was the loop within
AbstractSpacePermissionManager.getPermittedEntities(User user, List permissionTypes, List entities)
that was killing us...

I have patched confluence 1.4.4 - I will upload the patched src files.
Basically, I just did some IntelliJ refactorings (Introduce Parameter) to move the call to user.getGroups() back up the call stack outside of the loop.
I also moved out any obvious calls to user.getGroups that were still within loops after the refactoring.
With a bit more thought, some calls might propagate out further (there may be other loops lurking higher up the call stack) - and some calls might be avoided (we call user.getGroups() when it might be unnecessary)
fields.summary: Poor view/edit performance due to Permission checking when using external user management (Jira)

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-2229


create a 2x2 table.

in the first row, put text in both columns

in the second row, first column, press the "bullet" button and type any text

then press "enter" twice and your cell will have 3 lines with bullets, the last 2 of which are empty.

save the page and you will see that the resulting text will be:
|| test  || test  ||
| * test
* \\ |

rather than:
|| test  || test  ||

* | |

original database causes it to appear as a personal
label but does not cause Confluence to display the
favourite pages on the Dashboard.

fields.description:
Using also the standalone version of confluence, mapped to a mysql 4.1.12 database using latin1 encoding

Two issues:

- When adding a page with the euro sign (€), it first displays ? instead. Refreshing the page shows the € sign properly (I can live with that)
- Backuping / Restoring an instance on the same system: the € sign does not show anymore (replaced by ?). If I edit the page, the € is now replaced by ? as well. So all euro signs are lost by a restore. The exported XML contains the € sign

Encoding in Confluence is set to UTF-8. 

Using ISO-8859-1 fixes all those problems. But, If I do so, I can't post on IE anymore (see CSP-2278 on your support system)
fields.summary: encoding problem, euro sign not restored properly

fields.description:
For some reason, all the links to confluence from the email notifications that I receive are broken, whereas the links in the email notifications that my coworkers receive work correctly.

Confluence is setup on a server so that it is accessed at:  http://computer/confluence
And the Server Base URL in the general preferences is set to http://computer/

The links in the emails that I receive are missing the "confluence" part of the url, like so:   http://computer/display/ENG/PageName

If we change the Server Base URL setting to http://computer/confluence

Then the links i receive are correct, and the ones that everyone else gets are like so:  http://computer/confluence/confluence/ENG/PageName

What would cause this sort of branching to occur?  Why are the emails not generated identically for all users?

fields.description:
I created a space where I intended to collaborate with just one other person. I added her to the permisisons list, but I accidentally added her as a group rather than as an individual. 

When I looked at the permissions page, it seemed to me as if she had permission, but she could not see the space. Upon closer examination, I realized that I had added her user name as if it were a group name. 

Confluence should reject the name of a user when it is specified as a group permission.
fields.summary: Permissions adminstration permits adding a user as a group

fields.description:
Quite often for POST forms there is a equivalent GET that you can manually type in and it 'all works'. sometimes not.

Thus ...

  http://<server>/spaces/doexportspace.action?key=FOO&type=TYPE_PDF&includeComments=false

... works.

Works. It would be nice if there was some page advising on how one might try to recreate the other query string params.

fields.description:
The keywords could be used to allow selected export of some pages.

For example 'user-docs' may allow a subset of pages that mean something for users.

Also a field that allowed some sort of numerical ordering would be cool for a page.
fields.summary: Export pages matching specified keywords/labels

fields.description:
Adding a comment with Internet Explorer does not work with wiki markup. The preview and post button does not trigger anything (e.g. clicking on it doesn't  preview / post the comment). Switching to Rich text editor fixes the problem.

Both mode runs fine with Firefox 1.x and 1.5

Note that I can't reproduce this problem on confluence.atlassian.com with the same browser.
fields.summary: Preview and post buttons in add comment does not trigger anything in Wiki Markup mode with Internet Explorer

fields.description:
If you try to apply a style to part of a paragrpah, the entire paragraph gets the style -- see comment to CONF-5049

Steps to repro (from CONF-5409)
----- start test data ---- 
(select paragraph style) 
(type 'one') (press shift + enter key)
(type 'two') (press shift + enter key)
(type 'three') (press shift + enter key)
------ end test data -------

Expected: Applying style applies that style to only the text selected
Actual: Applying style applies style entire paragaph
fields.summary: Partial paragraph selection doesn't work in wysiwyg

fields.description:
This applies to Firefox -- need to test on IE as well Start out with the markup: * foo ** bar Problem 1 (cosmetic) Go to Rich Text Put the cursor after foo and press enter -- you get a second top-level bullet in front of the nested ul -- but the HTML is still OK Problem 2 Go to Rich Text Put the cursor before bar and press enter, then up arrow and type 'baz', so you have what looks like the markup: * foo ** baz ** bar The HTML is:
  • foo
    • baz
    • bar
and the
stuffs up the wysiwyg conversion, so that the markup produced is: * foo ** baz ** bar In other words, it is hard to add a new line to a nested list.
fields.summary: Adding lines in bullet lists breaks things

fields.description:
If you have increased the number of signed-up users in Confluence beyond the limit permitted by your license (say through JIRA user management), Confluence will cache/remember the fact that you now have too many users. It will do so for the duration of one hour before this result is recalculated. 

In this time, users will not be able to add or edit pages. Instead, they will get this warning: 

"You have exceeded the maximum number of users for your license"

Please note that even if you subsequently try to reduce the number of signed-up users below the license limit, the cached result will still hold.
fields.summary: You have exceeded the maximum number of users for your license error

fields.description:
Any user can decide to watch pages or subscribe to RSS feeds from the wiki.

However, there is no way to inform other users that something could be important for them: you have to open your email system and manually create a mail to all the individuals you want to inform and refer to the page URL.

I would be nice to be able to have a quick link on top of a page that would prepare a mail with the link to the page, and that would allow you to pick User Groups and/or individual users from the wiki. The user preparing this alert would be allowed to change the mail content. to add some relevant information.
Once confirmed, the system would send an email to all the users targeted (as individuals or as part of User Groups); the system would be able to send only one email to a user being part of several User Groups targeted by the alert.
fields.summary: Provide a way to mail to User Groups or Individual from a wiki page

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian-Confluence-Team,

FYI: I read about the same error description in CONF-5096 but i didn't find the corresponding Bug-Report, so here is mine:

Since upgrade from confluence 1.3.5. to confluence 2.1.1. and even after upgrade to 2.1.2. the following javascript error occurs. Affected Browsers are IE6 and FireFox 1.5, OPERA IS OK!!

1. If one click on "edit" an javascript error occurs (see screenshots of CONF-5096)
2. If one try to switch between RichText and WikiMarkup, the waitImage appears but nothing else happens
3. If one try to edit in RichText mode the changes are NOT SAVED AT ALL, but the change appears in the "recently changed list" (even if one clicks the "minor change checkBox")
4. If one try to edit in WikiMarkup (another user with another default) mode the changes ARE saved
5. The naming of the make-this-my-default-editor-link apperas to be labled incorrectly. The user with RichtText as default has a link named "make richtext default" and the user with WikiMarkup as default has a link named "make wiki markup default". Shouldn't it be vice versa?

The strange thing is that javascript error didn't occure directly after upgrading. After the upgrade to 2.1.1. i changed the default editor of my confluence user to "WikiMarkup" which is not possible any more. Something has happend meanwhile , but I have no clue what ...

Could you give me a hint to workaround this behaviour. Due to working with confluence i couldn't make a rollback to 1.3.5. ...

Kind regards

Thomas Eichstädt-Engelen
fields.summary: switch to "edit" causes javascript error, toggling between richText and wikiMarkup is broken

fields.description:
If a macro throws an uncaught exception, it can make the whole page unviewable.

Surround all macro execution with a catch (Throwable t) so whatever a macro throws (even an Error, since things like ClassDefNotFoundError are a distinct possibility with dynamically loaded plugins), it doesn't blow the whole page up.
fields.summary: Catch all errors that may be thrown from a macro

fields.description:
Exported a space with pages that had page permissions set.  Specifically edit permission set to confluence-administrators.  Restore to a different installation.  Page permissions are lost.

Saved from 1.4.3.  Restored on 2.1 and 2.1.2.

Space saved from 2.1 and restored on 2.1.2 worked correctly, so it has probably been fixed at some point.

I would be happy if you just documented (in this issue) under what circumstances this works correctly (from and to release).
fields.summary: Page permissions not restored when space restored
